info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 2:35PM EDT until July 09 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Washington County in east central New York... North central Rensselaer County in east central New York... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 235 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hoosick Falls, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hoosick Falls, Cambridge, Greenwich, Lee, Easton, Valley Falls, Center White Creek, Hoosick Junction, West Cambridge, Battenville, Post Corners, Center Falls, Johnsonville, East Buskirk, Eagle Bridge, Middle Falls, North Cambridge, Fly Summit, North Easton and Crandall Corners. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
